choices.text:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request. ### Instruction: How do you align a row of divs to the right using flex in css? Show me an example. ### Response: To align a row of div elements to the right using Flexbox in CSS, you can use the "order" property and set it to "1". Here's an example code snippet that demonstrates this: ```html
Div 1
Div 2
Div 3
Div 4
``` And here's the CSS code to align them to the right: ```css .flex-container { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; /* Align child elements to the right */ } ``` This will ensure that all div elements in the .flex-container are aligned to the right edge of their container.
